Class Utils

    • Utils

extends java.lang.Object
implements CheckerBoardConstants

        This is the amount of time that the computer players will be given to calculate a move.

    • Method Detail

      • printBoardState

        public static void printBoardState(int[][] arr)
        This method prints out the board state as represented by the 2 dimensional int array
        Parameters:
        arr - This is the board state that should be printed out.

      • copyBoardState

        public static int[][] copyBoardState(int[][] arr)
        This method makes a copy of the board state and returns it.
        Parameters:
        arr - This is the board state that you want to copy.
        Returns:
        The return value is a two dimensional array that is a copy of arr.

      • scoreCheckerBoard

        public static int scoreCheckerBoard(int[][] boardState,
                                    int whosTurn)
        This method is a scoring function for the checker board. It will return an integer indicating how good the board state is for both players. A large positive value is good for RED and a large negative value is good for BLACK.
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the board state for which a score will be generated.
        whosTurn - This indicates which players turn it is because that affects the score (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        Returns:
        An int is returned indicating the score for the provided board state.

      • executeMove

        public static java.util.Stack executeMove(int whosTurn,
                                          Move move,
                                          int[][] boardState)
        This method will update the board state by executing the move.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates which player is executing the move (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        move - This is the move that should be executed.
        boardState - This is the board state that should be updated by executing the move. This parameter is updated by the method.
        Returns:
        The return value is a stack of two dimensional arrays of int. The purpose of the return value is to allow the user to reset the board state (via the setBoardState method) to what it was before the move was executed.

      • checkForWinner

        public static int checkForWinner(int[][] boardState)
        This method checks for a winner given a board state and returns a value to indicate if it found one (RED_PLAYER, BLACK_PLAYER, or NEITHER_PLAYER).
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the board state for which we want to determine if there is a winner
        Returns:
        The return value is RED_PLAYER if red wins, BLACK_PLAYER if black wins, and NEITHER_PLAYER if nobody has won yet.

      • crownKings

        public static void crownKings(int[][] boardState)
        This method is used to crown kings in the given board state. Any black piece in the bottom row is crowned as a king, and any red piece in the top row is crowned a king.
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the board state for which we will crown kings. This parameter is modified by this method.

      • validMove

        public static int validMove(int whosTurn,
                            int[][] boardState,
                            Move move)
        This method is used to determine if a move is valid.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates which player will be attempting the move. (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the board state just before the move would be executed.
        move - This is the move that we are checking to see if it is valid.
        Returns:
        The return value indicates whether or not the move is valid. The possible return values are (VALID_MOVE, INVALID_MOVE, or VALID_MOVE_BUT_INCOMPLETE).

      • jumpExists

        public static boolean jumpExists(int whosTurn,
                                 int[][] boardState)
        This method returns true if a jump exists for the player specified by whos turn in the board state provided.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates which player you would like to check if a jump exists (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you would like to know if a jump exists
        Returns:
        Returns true if a jump exists for the players whos turn it is in the given board state.

      • jumpExists

        public static boolean jumpExists(int whosTurn,
                                 int[][] boardState,
                                 int fromRow,
                                 int fromCol)
        This method returns true if a jump exists from the row and column specified for the player specified by whos turn in the board state provided.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates which player you would like to check if a jump exists (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you would like to know if a jump exists
        fromRow - This is the row that the piece in question is in.
        fromCol - This is the column that the piece in question is in.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a jump exists for the players whos turn it is in the given board state.

      • getAllPossibleMoves

        public static java.util.Vector getAllPossibleMoves(int[][] boardState,
                                                   int whosTurn)
        This method will return all the moves that the player specified by whosTurn can make in the given board state.
        Parameters:
        boardState - This is the board state for which you will find all possible moves.
        whosTurn - This is the player that will be making the move (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        Returns:
        The return value is a vector of Move containing all the possible moves that the player can make from the given board state.

      • addMultipleJumps

        public static void addMultipleJumps(int fromRow,
                                    int fromCol,
                                    int[][] boardState,
                                    Move move,
                                    java.util.Vector possibleMoves)
        This method will add all possible combinations of jumps that can be made from the row and column specified in the given board state. It will then all all those possible moves to the possible moves vector.
        Parameters:
        fromRow - This is the row that the next jump must begin from
        fromCol - This is the column that the next jump must begin from
        boardState - This is the state of the board you must use when determining if there are more jumps to add.
        move - This is the move that we will be adding the additional jumps to. It currently consists of 1 jump (2 locations).
        possibleMoves - This is a vector that contains all of the possible moves for a player. We will be adding additional moves that we find to the vector. Therefore it may change.

      • setBoardState

        public static void setBoardState(java.util.Stack stateStack,
                                 int[][] boardState)
        This method will modify the board state by reversing the moves made and stored on the stateStack.
        Parameters:
        stateStack - This is a sequence of settings that modified the original board state that you are trying to restore. The settings on the top of the stack indicate what needs to be reset first.
        boardState - This is the current state of the board that you would like to change back to what it was before you executed certain moves on it. This parameter is modified by the method.

      • setBoardState

        public static void setBoardState(int[][] settings,
                                 int[][] boardState)
        This method will modify the board state by reversing a move made.
        Parameters:
        settings - This is a sequence of settings that modified the original board state that you are trying to restore.
        boardState - This is the current state of the board that you would like to change back to what it was before you executed a move on it. This parameter is modified by the method.

      • canMove

        public static boolean canMove(int whosTurn,
                              int[][] boardState,
                              int fromRow,
                              int fromCol,
                              int toRow,
                              int toCol)
        This method will determine whether or not a move (not a jump) is legal.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This is the player whos turn it is to move (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you would like to know if the move is legal.
        fromRow - This is the row that the piece is in that you are wondering if you can move.
        fromCol - This is the column that the piece is in that you are wondering if you can move.
        toRow - This is the row that you are wondering if you can move the piece to.
        toCol - This is the column that you are wondering if you can move the piece to.
        Returns:
        This method returns true if you can move the specified piece from the starting location to the desired location.

      • move

        public static int[][] move(int whosTurn,
                           int[][] boardState,
                           int fromRow,
                           int fromCol,
                           int toRow,
                           int toCol)
        This method will modify the board state provided by executing the move specified.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates the player whos turn it is (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the board state that will be modified.
        fromRow - This is the row of the piece that will be moved
        fromCol - This is the column of the piece that will be moved.
        toRow - This is the row where you will move the piece to.
        toCol - This is the column where you will move the piece to.
        Returns:
        The return value is the settings that you need to pass to the setBoardState method in order to restore the board state to what it was before you performed this move.

      • canJump

        public static boolean canJump(int whosTurn,
                              int[][] boardState,
                              int fromRow,
                              int fromCol,
                              int toRow,
                              int toCol)
        This method will determine whether or not a jump is legal.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This is the player whos turn it is to move (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the state of the board for which you would like to know if the jump is legal.
        fromRow - This is the row that the piece is in that you are wondering if you can move.
        fromCol - This is the column that the piece is in that you are wondering if you can move.
        toRow - This is the row that you are wondering if you can jump the piece to.
        toCol - This is the column that you are wondering if you can jump the piece to.
        Returns:
        This method returns true if you can jump the specified piece from the starting location to the desired location.

      • jump

        public static int[][] jump(int whosTurn,
                           int[][] boardState,
                           int fromRow,
                           int fromCol,
                           int toRow,
                           int toCol)
        This method will modify the board state provided by executing the jump specified.
        Parameters:
        whosTurn - This indicates the player whos turn it is (RED_PLAYER or BLACK_PLAYER).
        boardState - This is the board state that will be modified.
        fromRow - This is the row of the piece that will be moved
        fromCol - This is the column of the piece that will be moved.
        toRow - This is the row where you will jump the piece to.
        toCol - This is the column where you will jump the piece to.
        Returns:
        The return value is the settings that you need to pass to the setBoardState method in order to restore the board state to what it was before you performed this jump.

      • getOwner

        public static int getOwner(int piece)
        This method returns the owner of a piece (RED_PLAYER, BLACK_PLAYER, or NEITHER_PLAYER).
        Parameters:
        piece - This is the piece you are trying to find an owner for. It can be any integer from 1-10 corresponding to a type of board square.

      • readBoardState

        public static int[][] readBoardState(java.lang.String fileName)
